document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Leucophenga umbratula
Duda, 1924a : 187
; 1924b: 238;
Lin & Wheeler, 1972 : 253
;
Okada, 1987 : 679
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is mostly similar to
L . argentina
in having the wing fuscous along R1 only ( Fig. 2 A, F), and the shape of aedeagus ( Figs. 10 E, 14D), but can be distinguished from the latter by the color patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 8 C, D) and female ( Fig. 8 E), and the paramere rounded apically ( Fig. 14 C).

However, the specimens show distinctly difference from the latest and most relevant descriptions about
L . umbratula
from Taiwan , China ( Lin & Wheeler 1972 ; Okada 1987 ) in having the wing fuscous along R1 only ( Fig. 2 F), while no conspicuous difference could be found in having the thorax mostly dark colored ( Fig. 4 A, B), and in the color patterns of abdominal tergites in male ( Fig. 8 C, D). Therefore, all of the specimens were identified as
L . umbratula
to avoid further confusion.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Leucophenga
umbratula
Duda
, 1924
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods and aedeagus; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Ocellar triangle dark brown, with ca. 0–2 seta(e) above ocellar setae. Frons yellow in male, brownish yellow in female. Pedicel brownish yellow; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus brownish. Palpus brownish yellow to brownish. Mesonotum brownish yellow, with four brownish, longitudinal stripes submedially and laterally in male ( Fig. 4 A), brownish yellow, brownish before scutellum in female. Postpronotal lobe brownish yellow ( Fig. 4 B). Acrostichal setulae in ca. 6–8 irregular rows ( Fig. 4 A). Scutellum brown, dark brown laterally, brownish yellow at tip ( Fig. 4 A). Pleura with a brown, longitudinal stripe above ( Fig. 4 B). Katepisternum and meron brownish yellow, brownish above ( Fig. 4 B). Wing ( Fig. 2 F): Costal vein between R2+3 and R4+5 distally with ca. 4–5 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Abdominal tergites brown to dark brown, mostly yellow medially between 2nd to 4th or 5th tergites in male ( Fig. 8 C, D), entirely dark brown in female ( Fig. 8 E). Male terminalia: Epandrium with ca. 7 setae near posterior margin and ventral corner per side ( Fig. 14 A). Surstylus rounded apically ( Fig. 14 A). Hypandrium with 1 sensillum ( Fig. 14 B). Paramere with a remarkable wrinkle subdorsally and ca. 6 sensilla aligned above distally ( Fig. 14 C). Aedeagus slender, slightly expanded on posterodorsal 1/3 ( Fig. 14 D).

Specimens examined.
CHINA : 2♂ ( SCAU , Nos 128966, 67), Mangshan , Yizhang , Hunan , 24°55'N , 112°45'E ,
1200m
,

, ex tussocks, MF Xu

Sri Lanka
.
